Description of incident: A laptop was discovered missing in May.  It was held in a locked room in Hurley, but it was not encrypted or password protected.  The laptop contained the names, heights, weights, dates of birth, medical record numbers and lung function test results of 1,938 patients who visited Hurley between 2007 and May of 2011.  A total of 10 out of 150 of Hurley's laptops were not encrypted at the time of the discovery.
